sub_topic: Determining oxidation states of elements in inorganic compounds
message_1: Determine the oxidation state of the central atom in the compound [Fe(CN)6]4-.
message_2:
To determine the oxidation state of the central atom (Fe) in the compound [Fe(CN)6]4-, we first need to know the oxidation state of the other atoms in the compound.

The cyanide ion (CN-) has an overall charge of -1. Since there are six cyanide ions in the compound, the total charge contributed by the cyanide ions is -6.

The overall charge of the compound is -4, as given in the problem. To balance the charges, the oxidation state of the central atom (Fe) must be:

Fe + (-6) = -4

Fe = -4 + 6

Fe = +2

So, the oxidation state of the central atom (Fe) in the compound [Fe(CN)6]4- is +2.
